alert.note: Alert for Pocahontas; Randolph (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 12:19AM EST until January 11 at 12:00AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...A portion of northern West Virginia, including the following counties, Pocahontas and Randolph. * WHEN...Until 1100 AM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1215 AM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated an area of very heavy rainfall across the warned area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Rapid snowmelt is also occurring and will add to the flooding. High water has been reported along portions of route 219 near the communities of Valley Head and Huttonsville. The heaviest of the rain was over. A half of an inch or less of liquid equivalent rainfall is expected, as rain showers change to snow showers overnight, and then continue on Wednesday. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Elkins, Mill Creek, Dailey, Snowshoe, Mingo, Beverly, Huttonsville, Harman, Cheat Bridge, Valley Head, Glady, Monterville, Bowden, Slaty Fork and Dryfork. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Report flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
